content:
Meal planning can be a challenge! I'd be happy to help you with some delicious and quick weekday dinner recipes that feature fresh ingredients. Here are some ideas to get you started:

**Monday**

1. **One-Pot Pesto Chicken Pasta**: Cook pasta, chicken breast, cherry tomatoes, and fresh basil in a flavorful pesto sauce. Ready in 30 minutes.
2. **Grilled Chicken Fajitas**: Marinate chicken breast in lime juice and spices, then grill with bell peppers and onions. Serve with warm flour tortillas, sour cream, and salsa. Prep time: 20 minutes, cook time: 15 minutes.

**Tuesday**

1. **Baked Salmon with Roasted Vegetables**: Season salmon fillets with lemon and herbs, and bake in the oven with roasted asparagus, Brussels sprouts, and cherry tomatoes. Ready in 25 minutes.
2. **Quick Chicken and Broccoli Stir-Fry**: Stir-fry chicken breast, broccoli, and bell peppers in a wok or large skillet with some oil, garlic, and ginger. Serve with steamed rice or noodles. Prep time: 15 minutes, cook time: 10 minutes.

**Wednesday**

1. **Spaghetti with Fresh Tomato Sauce**: Cook spaghetti according to package directions, then top with a sauce made from fresh tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, and basil. Ready in 20 minutes.
2. **Black Bean and Corn Tacos**: Sauté diced onions, garlic, and black beans with cumin and chili powder. Serve in tacos with roasted corn, diced tomatoes, avocado, and sour cream. Prep time: 20 minutes, cook time: 15 minutes.

**Thursday**

1. **Lemon Herb Chicken Breast with Roasted Carrots**: Marinate chicken breast in a mixture of lemon juice, olive oil, and herbs, then grill or bake until cooked through. Serve with roasted carrots and a side salad. Ready in 25 minutes.
2. **Shrimp and Vegetable Skewers**: Alternate shrimp, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, and onions on skewers, brush with olive oil and grill or bake until cooked through. Serve with quinoa or couscous. Prep time: 15 minutes, cook time: 10 minutes.

**Friday**

1. **Chicken and Mushroom Creamy Pasta**: Cook pasta according to package directions, then top with a creamy sauce made from sautéed mushrooms, onions, and chicken breast. Ready in 25 minutes.
2. **Grilled Chicken and Pineapple Salad**: Grill chicken breast and slice, then serve on top of a mixed green salad with roasted pineapple, cherry tomatoes, and a citrus vinaigrette. Prep time: 15 minutes, cook time: 10 minutes.

These recipes are all quick, delicious, and packed with fresh ingredients. You can adjust the ingredients and portion sizes based on your personal preferences and dietary needs. Happy cooking!
